Reviews.Title: Wish I had gotten a better low-price model
Reviews.Author: Will Riddle "and Jaime Riddle"
Reviews.Content: If, like me, you're a normal person (i.e. NOT a techie) wanting to get the real deal on a low price laptop, this is it.Before Christmas, I read several dozen reviews before purchasing this laptop.  The main thing for me was the price, since none of my laptops have lasted more than 3 years, and my last one (Dell-500.00) only lasted 2yrs.  So I was very tempted to buy this ASUS, as it was advertised for $325 around the holidays.  I didn't really see very consistent complaints on the various websites I looked at (Best Buy, etc), so took the plunge but now wish that I hadn't.IT's not that this laptop is terrible.  It's not.  And it certainly has all the features I really needed: Windows 7, webcam, ok speakers, and good screen size.  It also is very light--a real plus.  It has good battery life so far, doesn't get hot, and doesn't have the annoying keyboard panel that is so common these days (the side panel with the extra set of numbers on it). From a list of externals, the computer fits the bill.FYI, it does NOT have an internal CD/DVD drive.also FYI, the speakers are on the bottom of the computer (where your legs hit), which is not a dealbreaker but weird.  Ok volume but makes it kind of muted.The big down side is the touchpad.  It's a dealbreaker.  A lot of people complained about odd things concerning the touchpad, like the sensitivity, but that kind of thing is fixable if you know what menu you're looking for.  What is not fixable is the actual design of the touchpad.  Firstly, the right and left click buttons are not raised or separated from the touchpad itself; nor are they distinguished from one another.  There is just a line painted on the pad that divides right from left.  This means that it is very awkward to click, select, and drag.  It's very easy to delete a whole selection you're highlighting, or right click when you mean to left click.  Many times I touch/click and nothing happens at all.  So far, after a month, my fingers have still not adjusted to this new set up--and I am having a hard time selecting/dragging, etc, accurately and quickly. It seems like maybe something under the pad does not have the right design/sensitivity because I have never struggled with this kind of thing before, not even on those computers which have the raised dot touchpad in the center of the keyboard.  This one is just OFF in a funny way.Also, it seems like the touchpad is located rather left of center.  So if you're left-handed, this may be the touchpad for you.  But if you are right handed like me, your right hand has to stretch quite a ways over to click/select.This is definitely the most annoying feature for me, enough to make me wish I had tried it out in the store first.  But I also have had some trouble with audio-visual speed/internet speed/printing speed which may or may not be related to the computer--but I sure didn't have trouble with my previous laptop, nor does anyone else experience it on our other house computers.  I think it might be a memory/RAM problem because I cannot watch Netflix (or listen to iTunes) and print/surf at the same time.  Lots of delays which, like I said, might be a problem with something else but I wouldn't take the chance.So, if you're on the fence about this machine like I was, and not able to really interpret other reviews to make a good decision, don't take the plunge just to save the money.  Maybe try the cheap Toshiba, which is also around $300, and, while heavy, cumbersome, and ugly, didn't have any of these problems.

Reviews.Title: Good Laptop for Business
Reviews.Author: Sonny Avery "tekkidd"
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop for work and after several months of owning it here are my impressions of it.In terms of external features, this laptop seems to offer a good bit, sporting an HDMI and VGA port, USB 3.0 port, multitouch track pad and a Webcam. Overall, the features are very good for the price you pay for it.Internal's on this laptop are on par with other budget laptops. Intel Pentium processor, 2-4GB of RAM and Intel integrated graphics wont hold up running AutoCAD or Photoshop very well but handle essential business apps like Outlook, Word and internet browsing just fine. Some apps like VLC can take up to 20 seconds to load but after loading, they run without issue.Overall construction isn't the best ive ever seen but its certainly not the worst. Laptop manufacturers these days have moved away from making laptops out of tough matte casing that lasts for years to shiny casing that looks good in-store but holds up poorly in day-to-day use. The casing on this laptop skips the gloss but still attracts some fingerprints and the screen is also glossy though a screen protector should fix that. Overall I've found the casing to be better than other budget laptops but still nothing compared to the casing found on proper business laptops (think Dell Precision and HP EliteBook). However you get what you pay for and for the money its not that bad.The laptop ships with Windows 7 Home Premium and there isn't too much to be said here in terms of features. The laptop is slowed somewhat by bloatware and the 64bit flavor of Windows 7. However if you're willing to get your hands dirty, re-installing Windows in the 32bit flavor and leaving out the bloatware should speed things up considerably.Overall you get what you pay for. For the money this laptop is one of the best deals on the market and with a few tweaks on the software side, this laptop will be a perfect companion for basic computing tasks.

Reviews.Title: Awesome piece of equipment
Reviews.Author: quality shopper
Reviews.Content: I love this lap top.  I wanted Windows 7 & this is it.  Others said the mouse is too touchy, but there are adjustments built in for the preferred touch.  The speakers underneath does hinder the sound.  I'm going to purchase an extra speaker, tho.

Reviews.Title: Good enough for school.
Reviews.Author: Seven
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a lap top for any sort of gaming outside of flash games. I got this computer because I needed something for school work. So far this laptop has been dependable and fast at loading, browsing, and the hard drive has not failed. The instant on is a great feature, and this laptop is really resilient. I love the customer service and the ASUS customer service. ASUS has always been a great company, and they are definitely a quickly rising star.

Reviews.Title: Great value, nice lappie
Reviews.Author: TekMac "Save abandoned, abused and unwanted C...
Reviews.Content: Awesome little lappie, nice kb, nice trackpad (very sensitive, though - I had to learn to be careful and use light touch) super light, crisp screen and great WiFi. Windows 7 is perfect on this machine. I call it the working man's Macbook Air, or my AsusAir.

Reviews.Title: Survived 1 year so far with a 13yr. old boy
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: After one year of owning this laptop, I can honestly say tat this is one of the toughest and best low end laptops you can find. I have accidently dropped it from four feet three or four times and all it has is some minor bumps and scratches. I have also been running some very demanding and cpu eating video games, which it didn't have a problem running. It is truly an amazing, tough laptop.

Reviews.Title: Problems since day 1
Reviews.Author: Pennell Hopkins
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop for one thing, to plug in my company provided USB and use the laptop for work.  Since you cannot access the bios to install the USB, I spent $125 on a tech who spent hours on the phone with ASUS who also did not understand how to access the bios.  Somehow, between the 2 of them and my money they got the computer to boot to the USB. Several weeks later I could not access the internet, but as the computer was still working with the USB, I relegated it to nothing but a vehicle for my USB.  Then I began getting warnings about unplugging the USB prior to the entire system shutting down.  When I turned on computer I could only get the bios and it was not working properly.  Four hours on the phone with ASUS support got me nowhere. The usual "remove the battery, count to 30, stand on your head rigamarole.  I found plenty of good instruction online, but none of it works with this computer. There is a defect in this computer.  DO NOT BUY it.  AMAZON customer service has been very helpful, though.

Reviews.Title: Very nice computer.
Reviews.Author: Jan
Reviews.Content: Very nice computer for the money. I bought this for my daughter and she can get online, play games,and do homework with ease.

Reviews.Title: Asus Laptop
Reviews.Author: JCW "JCW"
Reviews.Content: Arrived in a timely manner, however, there was no operating manual.  I have tried to get one sent to me, as I am new to using a laptop/notebook, but to no avail.  I had regular communication via email with someone who promised to send to me but never received ( 'Monkey's Mark Down Electronics - Amazon Marketplace').  I have enjoyed the laptop and what few things I wanted to do with it, especially SKYPE.

Reviews.Title: ASUS notebook computer
Reviews.Author: AMCow
Reviews.Content: We bought this computer as a gift for our middle school son, so he could do school work (and of course some games) without monopolizing our family computer.  The size and weight of the computer are ideal.  It's light and not too big.  My son can easily carry it to the kitchen to do his work.  The computer speed is great and it was a good fit for our son.

Reviews.Title: Great little laptop!
Reviews.Author: Wendy
Reviews.Content: We own this laptop in black...We purchased this same model refurbished from another online retailer for $244.00.  So far it has been a great value. We've had zero issues with it & once we did the Windows 7 updates & removed some of the bloat ware on it, it has operated flawlessly. My daughter uses it to play MineCraft mostly & there is no lag at all when playing. It has no issues connecting to the internet & has a strong wireless connection even though her room is some distance from our router. The keyboard has a good feel & the laptop is super light weight, so very portable.  She loves it.  The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because there is no optical drive & a back lit keyboard would have been nice. Great little laptop & really happy we found one with Windows 7. :)

Reviews.Title: Just what I needed
Reviews.Author: Lorna Gagneux
Reviews.Content: Small, quick and enough RAM to manage the multitasking. Lightweight, compact and easy for traveling and working in a variety of situations, both indoor and out.

Reviews.Title: Wooow Great machine at outstandin price
Reviews.Author: Ronny Lopez
Reviews.Content: I been using it for a few weeks now and by far a good machine for everyday use. Looking to replace your old laptop this is great value

Reviews.Title: New computer for this Grandma
Reviews.Author: Kathy Muscarella
Reviews.Content: This is a great upgrade for me from my older slower desk top. It is a very easy to use addition and I could immediately enjoy my favorite cyber sites. I did have some trouble understanding how to register it but a quick call to Asus was all the help I needed. I decided to go with a larger monitor for when I want to use it as a desk top but I have mostly been enjoying how more mobile I can be with my computing. More ease and ready access. One draw back but really no big deal, it did not have a built in camera. The price range fit my budget and Amazon made it really happen so easily since my family also kicked in a Mother's day gift card from Amazon so...Yeah! One happy Grandma here :-}

Reviews.Title: Slowest laptop in the world
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: Stay well clear from this piece of crap and do not read favorable reviews on it because they either work for Asus or are playing some kind of sick joke. Bbc computers that you used to get in schools 20 odd years ago run quicker than this. The speakers can be found at the bottom of the laptop so you cannot hear some videos. Space bar is shocking as well. Trading it in this week and taking a £180 hit but care as long as I get something that can play Youtube videos 360p and above.

Reviews.Title: Very Very poor :(
Reviews.Author: Lewigy
Reviews.Content: Were to start !!!  Very Very slow, stalls all the time.  Can't even cope with videos on youtube.  Touchpad is unresponsive sometimes.  It drives me crazy.  No DVD / CD drive either.  Ram is onboard soldered to the motherboard and can't be upgraded at all.  I would of thought 4gb of ram would be ok but somehow on this laptop it works slow and struggles.  2 things are good thou the screen is good (HD) and the keyboard is great.  Shame about the rest...  Makes me very upset that i bought this laptop after saving for months.  I used to love ASUS but now they've ripped me off :(

Reviews.Title: very nice, but not as fast as I would have prefered
Reviews.Author: jill tompson
Reviews.Content: This computer is a great size and very light.  My disapointment is this laptop is not super fast.  Sound isn't very loud either.

Reviews.Title: Quick tip for this Lappy
Reviews.Author: AlohaT
Reviews.Content: I have owned this laptop for a little while. The touchpad is very sensitive, like other reviewers it is an issue. I think mainly because how wide it is. But, I just put an Sandisk 8GB Sd ultra class 10 and am using it for readyboot. It has made a pretty good improvement. This laptop is very hard to upgrade ram. I am running it this way and it seems pretty good. All and all  is a good buy if you can deal with the touchy touch pad.I will also tell you that it boots from sleep very very fast. I would say maybe as fast as I have ever seen even ssd machines.Hope this helps.AlohaTPS Mine is the windows 7 machine

Reviews.Title: Poor quality control
Reviews.Author: EJ
Reviews.Content: The touch pad was a problem right out of the box. It should not be necessary to buy a mouse the very first day. On a positive note, the screen is beautiful and it is very light in weight.

Reviews.Title: Pretty nice
Reviews.Author: Kenya
Reviews.Content: My father really wanted a new computer and this was a good purchase. It's durable and it's perfect for my father's low needs.

Reviews.Title: Looks can be deceiving
Reviews.Author: Derek Elam
Reviews.Content: I bought this to use at school to take notes, primarily. Right out of the box, it had problems. The worst part of this notebook is the input. The spacebar barely works unless you press it firmly in the dead center. The touchpad is extremely over-sensitive, constantly clicks on its own (like if the palm of your hand touches the pad while typing, it'll click), and regularly does things I don't want it to do, like randomly clicking links in web pages as the cursor passes over them. The Ethernet port has a small hinge-like piece on the bottom that allows it to be more compact when not being used. Unfortunately, it usually gets stuck and it takes two hands to disconnect the ethernet cable.On the bright side, it does work, despite being loaded with bloatware and being insanely slow when you first set it up. For some reason the 320GB Hard Drive is partitioned into two 160GB partitions, one of which is blank. I give this 2 stars instead of 1 because it does work and has good battery life and decent specs, but it's obviously a cheaply-built laptop. It looks nice, but it's really a flimsy piece of plastic compared to other laptops in this price range. Consider your other buying choices from other brands.

Reviews.Title: maybe for some
Reviews.Author: basn
Reviews.Content: this was just too slow for me. I don't think it was worth the price for what you get. I went back to my old reliable.

Reviews.Title: Laptop is great except one THING!
Reviews.Author: Joe Adekunle
Reviews.Content: The laptop itself is great. Nice and thin, a little heavier than you would think for how thin it is. But lets be serious its not a Mac air. I still like it though. The resolution is nice, the keyboard are smooth. But the touch pad is not that firm. I have a feel within a couple of months or so with heavy useage there might cause a problem. The shipping was fast and it arrived almost new. If it was in the original box with all the paperwork you would think I was brand new.Now the reason for the one star. the laptop came with a VIRUS.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: Echo "Anerson"
Reviews.Content: This laptop came with a bunch of bloatware and that made the computer very slow. I was so happy to sell it back to a friend of mine. I would not recommend this to any one looking for s serious laptop.

Reviews.Title: peoples this is not for a pro....please.
Reviews.Author: ernestohdz2004
Reviews.Content: For what i need it is a good price of a nice brand,no that fast but very funtional,was made for me.

Reviews.Title: Worst computer frikkin ever
Reviews.Author: Falconbrother "Falcon"
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop for my wife and almost instantly she hated it (that was two days ago).  I cleaned up my two year old acer and gave it to her and she loves it.  This laptop is pretty miserable.  It's brand new and runs like a computer on it's last legs.  I hate it.  The touchpad is so sensitive that it screws up most everything you try to do.  Even though it appears to have suffecient on-board resources it locks up for a few moments all the time.  All the bloody time.  If I didn't have three hundred bucks tied up in this piece of junk I'd would use it for target practice.  In fact, in a couple of days I will be ready to sacrifice the three hundred and kill this loser.  It's worse than no computer at all.

Reviews.Title: Assisi computer
Reviews.Author: kantuc2
Reviews.Content: Nice computer, a little slow on boot,but sleep feature comes that problem pretty well why do I need to have review a specified length?

Reviews.Title: Piece of junk
Reviews.Author: Celtic Character "Celtic Character"
Reviews.Content: This laptop is cheaply made sometimes you get what you pay for, I immediately had problems with typing cursor jumped erratically a very frustrating experience.  It has since died and did not last 8 months.

Reviews.Title: NOT NEW AS SPECIFIED!
Reviews.Author: Daniel Joseph
Reviews.Content: The ad said BRAND NEW, NEVER OPENED laptop. The box was open, computer was turned on and played with. It came in a day being that I live in New York and it shipped from Brooklyn, but never the less; I was expecting a brand new, never opened laptop! Not a box that was open, finger prints all over the laptop, keyboard and screen!

Reviews.Title: IT'S OK COULD BE BETTER
Reviews.Author: MARGARET
Reviews.Content: I DO NOT LIKE THE MOUSE IT IS TOO SENSITIVE, I HAVE TROUBLE PLAYING GAMES IT IS TOO SLOW!!! I HAVE AN OLDER ONE THAT IS ALOY FASTER!!!

ProductInfo.Name: Asus Matte Deep Blue Square 14" X401U-EBL4 Laptop PC with AMD E1 1200 Processor, 4GB, 320GB HD, Webcam and Windows 7 Home Premium
